section1.p: This XEP defines how to send an CQP query over XMPP and how the XMPP answer in XML-TEI format looks like. This XEP also defines the the media answer thus in case the query delivers a media file, this media file is sent via ... XMPP ... TODO
The CQP standard is defined - irritatingly - in a tutorial only: http://cwb.sourceforge.net/files/CQP_Tutorial.pdf
The following terms from the field of Corpus Research are used throughout the document:

di.dd: A language corpus is a certain collection of natural language recources.
A spoken corpus is a collection of recources of spoken natural language. This can comprise media files, transcripts, metadate.

section1.p: UseCase: query a language corpus Use Case 1: Query a (spoken?) language corpus in ISO-TEI format via CQP and receive the queried chunks of the corpus. Do all this over XMPP.
